intro: Spergularia colorata, commonly known as the pink sandplant, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the northern hemisphere. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, pinkish flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments. It has a low-growing habit and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds. Spergularia colorata plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and is considered an indicator species for certain ecological conditions.
